refnamediv.refpurpose: Registering CORBA objects to Bonobo Activation.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When writing a component which can be activated through Bonobo Activation by clients, you need to be register your component to Bonobo Activation once it is created.

refsect2.title: enum Bonobo_RegistrationResult
bonobo_activation_unregister_active_server ()
refsect2.para: Unregisters obj with iid with the local bonobo-activation-server daemon.

listitem.simpara: IID of the server to unregister.

refsect2.title: bonobo_activation_registration_env_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the registration environment list, reg_env.

refsect2.title: bonobo_activation_registration_env_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: GSList* bonobo_activation_registration_env_set (GSList *reg_env, const char *name, const char *value);
refsect2.para: Sets the environment variable name to value in the registration environment list reg_env.

listitem.simpara: the name of the env variable (must not be NULL).
the value of the env variable (may be NULL).

refsect2.title: bonobo_activation_registration_env_set_global ()
refsect2.para: Sets the global registration environment list with the contents of reg_env. If append_if_existing is set to FALSE, the an existing global list will be overwritten.

listitem.simpara: whether or not to append to the global list.

refsect2.title: bonobo_activation_register_active_server ()
refsect2.programlisting: Bonobo_RegistrationResult bonobo_activation_register_active_server (const char *iid, CORBA_Object obj, GSList *reg_env);
refsect2.para: Registers obj with iid with the local bonobo-activation-server daemon.

If reg_env is not NULL, obj will be registered in such a way that if a client who's environment differs from the environment specified in reg_env, then another attempt to activate iid will not result in a reference to obj being returned, but rather another instance of iid being activated.
So, for example, you can ensure that a seperate instance of the component is activated for each distinct X display (and screen) by:
If reg_env is NULL, the global registration environment list will be used if it is set. See bonobo_activation_registration_env_set_global().

listitem.simpara: IID of the server to register.

refsect2.title: struct BonoboActivationPlugin
struct BonoboActivationPluginObject
bonobo_activation_plugin_use ()
refsect2.para: You should call this routine to activate a shared library-based CORBA Object. It will be called by OAF if the component exports correctly an BonoboActivationPlugin structure named "Bonobo_Plugin_info".

listitem.simpara: The impl_ptr that was passed to the original activation routine

refsect2.title: bonobo_activation_plugin_unuse ()
refsect2.para: Side effects: May arrange for the shared library that the implementation is in to be unloaded.
When a shlib plugin for a CORBA object is destroying an implementation, it should call this function to make sure that the shared library is unloaded as needed.

listitem.simpara: The impl_ptr that was passed to the activation routine
